tit.e: Izumizaki Yokoana Cave Tumulus (a horizontal decorated cave tumulus in Fukushima Prefecture)
tit.cmt: 用語を変え、補足しました。
tit.e: Izumizaki Yokoana Cave Tumulus (a horizontal decorated cave tumulus in Fukushima Prefecture)

sen.j: 泉崎横穴（いずみざきよこあな）は、福島県西白河郡泉崎村にある横穴式装飾古墳。
sen.e: Izumizaki Yokoana is a Yokoanashiki Soshoku Kofun (decorated cave tomb) located in Izumizaki-mura, Nishishirakawa-gun, Fukushima Prefecture.
Izumizaki Yokoana Cave is a horizontal decorated cave tumulus located in Izumizaki-mura, Nishishirakawa County, Fukushima Prefecture.
Izumizaki Yokoana Cave is a horizontal decorated cave tumulus located in Izumizaki-mura, Nishishirakawa County, Fukushima Prefecture.

sen.j: 昭和8年（1933年）の県道拡張工事の際に発見された。
sen.e: It was discovered in 1933 at the time of an expansion work for a prefectural road.
It was discovered in 1933 at the time of an expansion work for a prefectural road.
It was discovered in 1933 at the time of an expansion work for a prefectural road.

sen.j: 昭和9年（1934年）には国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: It was designated as a national historic site in 1934.
It was designated as a national historic site in 1934.
It was designated as a national historic site in 1934.

tit.e: Mural painting in the stone chamber
Mural painting in the stone chamber
Mural painting in the stone chamber

sen.j: 石室の奥壁には、右から順に2頭の動物像、矢を射る騎馬人像、大の字形に手足を広げて手を繋いでいる4人の人物像、器物を持った3人の人物像が横一列に朱色で描かれている。
sen.e: On the inner wall of the stone chamber, figures of two animals, a person on horseback shooting an arrow, four persons outstretching arms and legs and holding hands with each other and three persons holding articles were drawn in Shu-iro (Empire red) from right to left lining up sideways.

On the inner wall of the stone chamber, figures of two animals, a person on horseback shooting an arrow, four persons outstretching arms and legs and holding hands with each other and three persons holding articles were drawn in Shu-iro (Empire red) from right to left lining up sideways.

On the inner wall of the stone chamber, figures of two animals, a person on horseback shooting an arrow, four persons outstretching arms and legs and holding hands with each other and three persons holding articles were drawn in Shu-iro (Empire red) from right to left lining up sideways.

sen.j: 左壁には渦巻文や騎馬人像、馬や小動物、右壁には臼と馬、天井には渦巻文が数個、すべて朱色で描かれている。
sen.e: A Uzumaki mon (spiral) design, a person on horseback, a horse and small animals on the left wall, mill-stone and a horse on the right wall and several spirals on the ceiling were drawn all in Shu-iro.

Uzumaki-mon (a decorative spiral pattern), a person on horseback, a horse and small animals on the left wall, mill-stone and a horse on the right wall and several Uzumaki-mon pattern on the ceiling were drawn all in Empire red.

Uzumaki-mon (a decorative spiral pattern), a person on horseback, a horse and small animals on the left wall, mill-stone and a horse on the right wall and several Uzumaki-mon pattern on the ceiling were drawn all in Empire red.

sen.j: 石室からは、直刀・刀子・銅環などの副葬品が出土している。
sen.e: Burial goods including Chokuto (straight sword), Tosu (small knife) and Dokan (Copper earring) were excavated from the stone chamber.
sen.cmt: 「銅環」は下記サイトを参考に、「earring」と訳しました。http://www.pref.mie.jp/haku/hp/osusume/jikan.htm「耳環（じかん）は、今でいうイヤリングのような耳飾りのことです」「古墳時代になると金や銀・銅などの金属を使ったものが登場します」。
sen.e: Burial goods including Chokuto (straight sword), Tosu (small knife) and Dokan (Copper earring) were excavated from the stone chamber.
Burial goods including Chokuto (straight sword), Tosu (small knife) and Dokan (Copper earring) were excavated from the stone chamber.

sen.j: なお、古墳は7世紀前半に造営されたとされている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Kofun is deemed to have been constructed in the early 7th century.
Furthermore, the Kofun is deemed to have been constructed in the early seventh century.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Kofun is deemed to have been constructed in the early seventh century.

sen.j: 泉崎横穴の約2キロメートル南にある関和久官衙遺跡は古代白河郡の郡衙（郡役所）跡で、7世紀末から8世紀初頭に成立した。
sen.e: The Sekiwagu Kanga Site located at about two kilometers south of Izumizaki Yokoana is the ancient site of Gunga (county government offices) of the ancient Shirakawa County and established from the end of the 7th century to the early 8th century.

The Sekiwagu Kanga Remain located at about two kilometers south of Izumizaki Yokoana Cave is the ancient site of Gunga (county government offices) of the ancient Shirakawa County and established from the end of the seventh century to the early eighth century.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: The Sekiwagu Kanga Remain located at about two kilometers south of Izumizaki Yokoana Cave is the ancient site of Gunga (county government offices) of the ancient Shirakawa County and established from the end of the seventh century to the early eighth century.

sen.j: また、阿武隈川を挟んだ対岸にはその附属寺院跡（借宿廃寺）があり、その近くには6世紀後半の築造とされる下総塚古墳（前方後円墳）、6世紀後半の豪族居館跡である舟田中道遺跡、7世紀のものとされる谷地久保古墳がある。
sen.e: There are the ancient site of its affiliated temple (Kariyadohai-ji Temple) across the Abukuma-gawa River, Shimousazuka Kofun (ancient tomb) (large keyhole-shaped tomb mound) nearby which is deemed to have been constructed in the late 6th century, The Funada Nakamichi Site which is the ancient site of a residence of Gozoku (local ruling family) in the late 6th century and the Yajikubo Kofun (ancient tomb) which is deemed to have been constructed in the 7th century.

There are the ancient site of its affiliated temple (Kariyadohai-ji abandoned Temple) across the Abukuma-gawa River, Shimosazuka-kofun Tumulus (a large keyhole-shaped mound) nearby which is deemed to have been constructed in the late sixth century, the Funada Nakamichi Remain which is the ancient site of a residence of Gozoku (local ruling family) in the late sixth century and the Yajikubo-kofun Tumulus which is deemed to have been constructed in the seventh century.
sen.cmt: 用語などを変えました。
sen.e: There are the ancient site of its affiliated temple (Kariyadohai-ji abandoned Temple) across the Abukuma-gawa River, Shimosazuka-kofun Tumulus (a large keyhole-shaped mound) nearby which is deemed to have been constructed in the late sixth century, the Funada Nakamichi Remain which is the ancient site of a residence of Gozoku (local ruling family) in the late sixth century and the Yajikubo-kofun Tumulus which is deemed to have been constructed in the seventh century.

sen.j: これらの遺跡より、6世紀後半から8世紀初めまでの白河地方の中心地はこの一帯（福島県西白河郡泉崎村南部・白河市北部地域）と推定され、泉崎横穴を含めたこれらの遺跡群は白河国造から古代白河郡への変遷を解明する上で重要である。
sen.e: In view of these remains, the central area of the Shirakawa region from the late 6th century to the early 8th century is presumed to have been this area (the southern part of Izumizaki-mura, Nishishirakawa-gun, Fukushima Prefecture and the northern part of Shirakawa City) and these remains including Izumizaki Yokoana are important for making clear the changes from Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko to the ancient Shirakawa County.

In view of these remains, the central area of the Shirakawa region from the late sixth century to the early eighth century is presumed to have been this area (the southern part of Izumizaki Village, Nishishirakawa County, Fukushima Prefecture and the northern part of Shirakawa City) and these remains including Izumizaki Yokoana Cave are important for making clear the changes from the era of Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko (regional administrator of Shirakawa Province) to the ancient Shirakawa County.

In view of these remains, the central area of the Shirakawa region from the late sixth century to the early eighth century is presumed to have been this area (the southern part of Izumizaki Village, Nishishirakawa County, Fukushima Prefecture and the northern part of Shirakawa City) and these remains including Izumizaki Yokoana Cave are important for making clear the changes from the era of Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko (regional administrator of Shirakawa Province) to the ancient Shirakawa County.

sen.j: なお、関和久官衙遺跡と舟田中道遺跡・谷地久保古墳・下総塚古墳（白河舟田・本沼遺跡群）は国史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Sekiwagu Kanga Site, the Funada Nakamichi Site, the Yajikubo Kofun and the Shimousazuka Kofun (Shirakawa Funada Motonuma sites) were designated as national historic sites.

Furthermore, the Sekiwagu Kanga Remain, the Funada Nakamichi Remain, the Yajikubo-kofun Tumulus and the Shimosazuka-kofun Tumulus (Shirakawa Funada Motonuma remain groups) were designated as national historic sites.

Furthermore, the Sekiwagu Kanga Remain, the Funada Nakamichi Remain, the Yajikubo-kofun Tumulus and the Shimosazuka-kofun Tumulus (Shirakawa Funada Motonuma remain groups) were designated as national historic sites.
